summary: The S&P 500 Index ($SPX) (SPY) Friday closed down -0.22%, the Dow Jones Industrials Index ($DOWI) (DIA) closed up +0.08%, and the Nasdaq 100 Index ($IUXX) (QQQ) closed down 0.43% The Wall Street Journal reported that a top US official had told top global semiconductor makers that the US might revoke waivers for allies with semiconductor plants in China . Negative trade news also pressured stocks after the Financial Times reported that Japan had canceled a top-level trade meeting with the US .  Stocks initially moved higher on Friday, driven by a Reuters report that the Iranian government said it is ready to discuss limitations on its uranium enrichment . Stocks were supported by speculation that the US will give negotiations a chance before deciding to enter the Israel-Iran war .  May index of leading economic indicators (LEI) fell -0.1% m/m, right on expectations . Iran has not tried to close the vital Strait of Hormuz that handles about 20% of the world's daily crude shipments . Iran said it won't negotiate with the US while Israel's assault continues .  Markets discounting chances at 17% for a -25 bp rate cut at the July 29-30 FOMC meeting . T-notes recovered from early losses and moved higher on weaker-than-expected Philadelphia Fed business outlook survey . September 10-year T-note yield fell -1.6 bp to 4.375% .  T-notes initially moved lower on reduced safe-haven demand after President Trump vowed to seek a diplomatic solution on Iran’s nuclear program over the next two weeks . Rising inflation expectations are bearish for T-note prices after the US 10-year breakeven inflation expectations rate Friday rose to a 2-week high at 2.34% European government bond yields on Friday were mixed .  Chip makers turned lower on Friday and weighed on the broader market . Weakness in the Magnificent Seven stocks Friday was a negative factor for the overall market . However, Apple (AAPL)bucked the trend and closed up more than +2%. Accenture (ACN) closed down more than -6% to lead losers in the S&P 500 .  Kroger (KR) closed up more than +9% to lead gainers in the S&P 500 . CarMax (KMX) reported Q1 net sales of $7.55 billion, stronger than expectations . GMS Inc (GMS) reported that Home Depot had made an offer for the company .  Mondelez International (MDLZ) closed up more than +2% to lead gainers in the Nasdaq 100 after Wells Fargo Securities upgraded the stock to overweight from neutral with a price target of $78 . Fair Isaac Co (FICO) announced a stock repurchase program to acquire up to $1 billion of the company's outstanding common stock . Darden Restaurants reported that Q4 comparable same-store sales rose 4.60%, stronger than the consensus of 3.46% .

Analysts reboot Micron Technology stock price target ahead of earnings . Boise, Idaho, company makes memory and storage chips for data centers, computers and smartphones . Its client list includes such tech-sector superstars as Nvidia, Apple, Facebook and Microsoft .  Micron is a key player in the HBM market, offering solutions like HBM3E and HBM4 designed for high-performance computing and AI applications . Micron recently joined the Trump administration to unveil plans to expand its U.S. investments to about $150 billion in domestic memory manufacturing and $50 billion in research and development .  Wedbush boosted its price target on Micron to $150 from $130 . The firm said memory-pricing trends turned more positive in the second quarter . The company's shares are up nearly up nearly 45% this year and off 16% from this time in 2024 .  Morgan Stanley maintained an equal-weight rating and $98 price target on Micron . But the investment firm is "tactically bullish," given that AI spending is materially accelerating as Micron grows its participation .  Morgan Stanley also highlights Sandisk, which it likes better long term . Consensus numbers have started to come up for Micron over the past few weeks . Morgan Stanley is about 20% above consensus for August earnings per share .

Nvidia (NVDA) shares are in focus on Friday following reports the AI chip giant is venturing into a new frontier: humanoid robots . Foxconn is reportedly developing humanoid robots in collaboration with Nvidia, with plans of deploying them at its new Houston facility . These machines will reportedly help assemble Nvidia’s AI servers – marking the first time for one of its products to be built with assistance from humanoid robots – .  Foxconn is significant for investors given it showcases demand for its Isaac robotics platform and Jetson AI chips . Barclays analyst Tom O’Malley expects continued AI demand to help Nvidia beat estimates in the second half of 2025 .  Barclays reiterated its “Overweight” rating on Nvidia shares on Friday and raised its price target to $200 . The consensus rating on NVDA shares currently sits at “Strong Buy” with the mean target of about $175 indicating potential upside of some 22% from here .

Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) recently announced a partnership with Microsoft to collaboratively create silicon for a wide range of devices, including the next Xbox console . AMD shares are now higher by more than 9% over the previous five trading days .  Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is a global leader in semiconductors based in Santa Clara, California . AMD is valued at over $205 billion and competes fiercely with Intel (INTC) and Nvidia (NVDA) AMD shares are down 20% over the past 52 weeks and are more than 40% off record highs .  AMD's first quarter 2025 results exceeded expectations across the board . The company generated revenue of $7.44 billion, 36% higher year-over-year, and non-GAAP EPS of $0.96 trounced consensus by a wide margin . Segment by segment, data center revenue increased 57% year over year to $3.7 billion . Client segment revenue increased 68% to $2.3 billion with strong Ryzen processor sales .  AMD’s consensus price target is $133.32, translating to around 4% upside potential from its current price . The most bullish and bearish targets are $200 with 56.3% of upside and $95 with 25.8% of downside risk .

CrowdStrike Holdings experienced a 34% price increase over the past quarter . The company's legal victory in June, where a U.S. District Court dismissed a class-action suit, may have strengthened investor confidence . CrowdStrike's strategic initiatives in cybersecurity enhanced its attractiveness to investors .  CrowdStrike shares have soared over the past five years, achieving a total return of 391.10%, showcasing considerable growth over this period . The introduction of Falcon Flex and AI capabilities are aligning well with enhanced customer relationships and operational efficiencies . Analysts anticipate revenue and earnings projections will grow by 23.0% annually over the next three years .  CrowdStrike Holdings' share price of US$443.21 is slightly above the analyst consensus price target . Company's current share price suggests investors will closely watch future growth to justify valuation .  Inventorial-team@simplywallst.com has been contacted by SimplyW.com to answer questions about the role of the author .

NVIDIA recently announced a collaboration with Tech Soft 3D to enhance its Universal Scene Description and Omniverse platform . Over the last quarter, NVIDIA’s share price increased 24%, reflecting broader interest in tech and 3D interoperability advancements . Earnings from Q1 2026 showed significant growth, with sales jumping to $44 billion, potentially supporting this move .  NVIDIA's collaboration with Tech Soft 3D to enhance its Universal Scene Description and Omniverse platform may bolster its positioning in 3D technology . Over the past five years, NVIDIA's total shareholder return, including share price appreciation and dividends, was very large, highlighting significant long-term growth .  NVIDIA's share price around $113.54, compared to the analyst consensus price target of $163.12 . This indicates potential upside as the company navigates challenges such as U.S. regulatory issues and production costs associated with its next-gen systems .  Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned . Companies discussed in this article include NasdaqGS:NVDA and Nasdaq GS: NVDA .

Nuclear startup TerraPower announced a new $650 million funding round this week . The investment will help the company build its first commercial power plant in Wyoming . Nvidia’s venture arm, NVentures, participated in the round, marking its first energy investment .  TerraPower’s Natrium reactors are cooled not by water but by molten sodium . The storage system is designed to produce up to 500 megawatts of electricity for more than five hours . TerraPower claims it can complete a reactor within three years after the first batch of concrete is poured .  The Associated Press reported last year that the bill could reach $4 billion, half of that could be shouldered by the Department of Energy . preparation and construction needs to happen before the first reactor is built .

AI prospects remain strong, with AI expanding from major cloud service providers to large-scale enterprise deployments and edge computing with PCs . The company is benefiting from the Windows 11 PC refresh cycle as many enterprise customers upgrade to new AI-capable Windows 11 devices .  Growing interest in generative artificial intelligence-enabled PCs, along with Windows 11 upgrades and a probable PC refreshment cycle, is likely to drive fresh demand for PCs in 2025 . Dell Technologies and NVIDIA expanded their AI Factory collaboration, introducing new AI PCs, infrastructure, software, and services to accelerate enterprise AI adoption across various scales .  Apple’s Mac business is benefiting from strong demand for M4, M4 Pro, and M4 Max chips . HP has launched several AI PCs this year and plans to continue to expand its AI PC portfolio . DELL stock is trading at a premium, with a forward 12-month Price/Sales of 0.77X . The Zacks Consensus Estimate for second-quarter fiscal 2026 earnings is pegged at $2.26 per share .  DELL currently flaunts a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) The consensus mark for fiscal 2026 earnings is pegged at $9.43 per share, which increased 6.91% in the past 30 days . This suggests 15.85% year-over-year growth .

Nvidia and Foxconn are reportedly considering the use of humanoid robots at a soon-to-launch AI server production plant in Houston . The Houston site is expected to beginassembling Nvidia's GB300 AI servers in early 2026 . Robots under training have been tasked with assembly operations, cable insertion, and handling duties .  Foxconn also plans to unveil two humanoid robot models at a company event in November, one legged, the other using a wheeled autonomous mobile base, which may be a lower-cost option .

Innodata's INOD Digital Data Solutions (DDS) segment continues to anchor its growth . DDS segment revenues surged 158% year over year to $50.8 million in the first quarter of 2025 .  Innodata’s DDS business faces competition from emerging AI service providers like BigBear.aiBBAI and Grid DynamicsGDYN .  Grid Dynamics supports full-cycle GenAI adoption, helping Fortune 100 clients with custom LLM development, prompt engineering and deployment . Innodata stock is trading at a premium, with a forward 12-month Price/Sales of 5.49X compared with the Computer Services industry’s 1.81X .  The consensus mark for Innodata’s fiscal 2025 earnings is pegged at 69 cents per share, which has remained unchanged over the past 30 days . The figure marks a decline of 22.47% from fiscal 2024's earnings . Innodata carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold)

The S&P 500 Index ($SPX) (SPY) today is down -0.26%, the Dow Jones Industrials Index ($DOWI) (DIA) is up +0.09%, and the Nasdaq 100 Index ($IUXX) (QQQ) is down 0.59% Stocks initially moved higher on signs of easing tensions in the Middle East . Stocks have support on speculation that the US will give negotiations a chance before deciding to enter the Israel-Iran war .  June Philadelphia Fed business outlook survey was unchanged at -4.0, weaker than expectations of an increase to -1.5 . May index of leading economic indicators fell -0.1% m/m, right on expectations, and sixth consecutive month the LEI has declined . Trading activity today may be more volatile than usual due to the expiration of $6.5 trillion in June options, futures, and derivatives contracts .  Hostilities between Israel and Iran entered an eighth day today with no signs of easing . FOMC cut its US GDP forecast and raised its inflation forecast for this year . Iran said it won't negotiate with the US while Israel's assault continues .  Investors are bracing for negative tariff news within the next week or so following President Trump's announcement last Wednesday that he intends to send letters to dozens of US trading partners . The markets are discounting the chances at 15% for a -25 bp rate cut at the July 29-30 FOMC meeting .  T-notes recovered from worst levels on weaker-than-expected Philadelphia Fed business outlook survey . Eurozone Jun consumer confidence index unexpectedly fell -0.1 to -15.3, weaker than expectations of an increase to -14.9 . German PPI fell -1.2% y/y, right on expectations and biggest decline in 8 months .  Chip makers turned lower today and are weighing on the broader market . Weakness in the Magnificent Seven stocks is a negative factor for the overall market . Swaps discounting the chances at 6% for a -25 bp rate cut by the ECB at the July 24 policy meeting .  Kroger (KR) is up more than +7% to lead gainers in the S&P 500 after reporting Q1 adjusted EPS of $1.49 . GMS Inc (GMS) up +29% after Wall Street Journal reports Home Depot has made an offer for GMS . CarMax (KMX) is +5% up after Q1 net sales of $7.55 billion, stronger than expectations . Jack in the Box (JACK) downgraded to hold from buy .  Mondelez International (MDLZ) is up more than +3% to lead gainers in the Nasdaq 100 after Wells Fargo Securities upgraded the stock to overweight from neutral with a price target of $78 . Darden Restaurants (DRI) reported that Q4 comparable same-store sales rose 4.60%, stronger than the consensus of 3.46%.

U.S. companies remain largely in the dark on when they’ll receive crucial magnets from China . President Donald Trump declared a “done” trade deal with Beijing 10 days ago . Many American firms that need Chinese minerals are still waiting on Beijing’s approval for shipments .  Some firms wait for magnets and others face restrictions selling to China . That friction risks derailing a fragile tariff truce clinched by Washington and Beijing last month .  Trump last month restricted US firms from exporting chip software, jet engines and a key ingredient to make plastic to China . Companies subject to Washington’s curbs have halted billions of dollars in planned shipments as they wait for players in unrelated sectors to secure permits from Beijing .  Energy and chemical giant INEOS Group Holdings SA has one tanker full of ethane waiting to go, while Enterprise Products Partners has three to four cargo ships stuck in limbo . China has adequate ethane supplies in reserve and can switch to using naphtha from the Middle East and other regions for much of their production .  Access to rare earths is an issue “that is going to continue to metastasize until there is resolution” China only agreed to grant licenses — if at all — for six months, before companies need to reapply for approvals . Firms doing business in the US and China could see recurring interruptions .  The terms of the deal were never publicized in writing by either side . Beijing still hasn't officially spelled out the deal’s requirements, nor has Xi publicly signaled his endorsement of it . Complicating the issue, companies often buy magnets from third-party suppliers, which serve defense and auto firms .  China’s Commerce Ministry is working to facilitate more approvals even as it asks for reams of information on how the materials will be used, people say . Some companies have been asked to supply data including detailed product designs, one of the people said . Chinese officials have expedited shipments for some major US and European automakers since Trump announced the agreement .  Trump’s agreement “will allow for rare earths to flow out of the country for a short period of time,” Hammer said . “Nobody trusts that this thaw is going to last.” Ford Motor Co. says rare-earths licenses have already forced the company to temporarily shutter one plant .  The automaker has an exclusive deal to get the products from MP Materials Corp. in Texas, with production starting later in the year . It has another deal with eVAC of Germany to get magnets from a South Carolina plant starting in 2026 . Scout Motors CEO Scott Keogh said his company is re-engineering brakes and drive units to reduce the need for rare earths . Scout is building a plant in South Carolina to make fully electric and hybrid SUVs as well as trucks .  Restrictions on sales to China of electronic design automation software for chipmaking are emblematic of the standoff . Those tools are used to design everything, from the highest-end processors for the likes of Nvidia Corp. and Apple . Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the measures were used to ‘annoy’ China into complying with a deal US negotiators thought they’d already reached .  There’s worry that heightened geopolitical risks will push Chinese customers to hunt for other suppliers or further develop domestic capabilities . “The risk is there for the London deal to fall apart,” said chief economist for Asia Pacific at Natixis .

The S&P 500 is now less than 3% below its record high . The Nasdaq Composite is 3.4% off its all-time peak . The Dow Jones Industrial Average remains only marginally positive for the year .  China faced tariffs ranging from 34% to 54%, the European Union 20%, Japan 24% and Vietnam up to 46% . On May 30, Trump doubled tariffs on imported steel, raising them from 25% to 50% . The U.S. Court of International Trade ruled that many of the tariffs were illegal under international trade law .  The S&P 500 hit a record high on Feb. 19 before tumbling toward bear market territory by April 8 . However, the index staged a remarkable rebound, marking its fastest recovery since 1982 . Palantir Technologies has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) and a Growth Score of A .  NewmontNEM, having a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), is one of the best-performing stocks of the first half . The stock saw a positive earnings estimate revision of 5 cents for this year over the past month . Newmont has a VGM Score of A, indicating that it is poised for more gains ahead .  NVIDIA is capitalizing on an unprecedented demand cycle for its AI chips . Since bottoming at just over $94 in early April, NVDA stock has added more than $1 trillion in market value . Growth-focused traders are flocking to NVIDIA for its unprecedented AI chip momentum .  Gold recently soared to a new all-time high, topping $3,400 per ounce last month . Investors are turning to the precious metal to shield their portfolios from the disruptive impact of Trump’s tariffs on global trade . Escalating tensions in the Middle East have intensified safe-haven demand .  AngloGold Ashanti PLC has a Zacks Rank #1 and has a VGM Score of A, underscoring its compelling investment potential amid the ongoing gold rally . Despite more than doubling year to date, AngloGold remains attractively valued, trading at a P/E ratio of 9.80 .

Tesla's long-awaited Robotaxi launch is finally happening on June 22 in Austin, Texas . CEO Elon Musk is expected to unveil the Cybercab — Tesla’s first fully autonomous vehicle with no steering wheel or brake pedals . While this headline moment dominates the news cycle, investors shouldn’t ignore the rest of the autonomous vehicle (AV) playing field .  The June 22 event marks a critical milestone for Tesla’s artificial intelligence (AI) roadmap . Investors are watching closely for product details and updates on federal approvals . Tesla just received a regulatory boost from the Trump administration .  Stocks like Innoviz (INVZ) and AEVA Technologies (AEVA) are getting attention for their advanced LiDAR systems and recent deal activity . Nvidia-backed WeRide just scored a major partnership with Tencent (TCEHY) and is expanding across Asia and Europe .  Want to see how Tesla stacks up against Waymo, Uber, Amazon, and Nvidia? Watch our Robotaxi launch reel now for everything you need to know . Then, use our Barchart tools to line up your best robotaxi trade: Track Top Trade Alerts for TSLA .

Marvell TechnologyMRVL is enhancing its role in artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure by expanding its custom chip capabilities . Marvell continues to integrate its custom compute platform with new components that improve performance, scalability, and integration across large-scale systems .  MRVL's custom chips are gaining credibility and traction, even among companies like NVIDIA . In the same month, MRVL introduced its new multi-die packaging solution, built on its proprietary interposer technology .  AVGO’s AI networking revenues jumped 170% year over year and now comprise 40% of its total AI semiconductor revenues . AVGO also introduced the Tomahawk 6 switch with a 102.4 Terabits per second switch capacity .  Shares of Marvell Technology have plunged 31.9% year to date against the Electronics - Semiconductors industry’s growth of 6.4% . The move enables Broadcom to achieve better performance in training its next-generation frontier models through lower latency, higher bandwidth and lower power .  Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD) and Marvell Technology (MRVL) are among the top semiconductor companies in the U.S. market . AMD is one of the leading semiconductor chip makers in the world .

NBIS reported 385% year-over-year revenue expansion in the first quarter . Its recurring revenue model is growing, with management targeting a $750 million–$1 billion run-rate by 2025 . Nebius enables enterprise clients to leverage NVIDIA’s Blackwell AI Factory platform .  Nebius is well-positioned to meet the growing enterprise demand for scalable, high-performance AI solutions . Nebius has also expanded its global AI infrastructure with the deployment of NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra GPUs in the U.K.  Nebius is emerging as a strong contender in the AI infrastructure space . It will also benefit the U.K.’s academic and research sectors, as well as public services like the NHS .  Microsoft is a major player in AI infrastructure with its Azure platform, backed by a wide global data center network . With availability in more than 60 announced regions, Azure continues to strengthen its position in the cloud computing market .  NBIS trades at a forward price-to-sales of 11.19X, higher than the industry’s 4.01X . The Zacks Consensus Estimate for NBIS’ earnings for 2025 has been unchanged over the past 30 days . NBIS currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold)

Analyst Thomas O’Malley at Barclays raised his price target on the stock from $170 to $200 . The new target reflects significant upside potential for Nvidia in the second half of the year . The rating affirmation asserts that Barclays continues to feel optimistic about NVIDIA’s market potential and performance trajectory .  NVIDIA revises its Compute revenue forecasts for the third and fourth calendar quarters to $42 billion and $48 billion . Blackwell Ultra is on track, and its mass production is scheduled for third quarter . The firm has revised its prior projections and the Street consensus .  15 AI Stocks Making Waves on Wall Street are making waves in the AI market . None of the AI stocks have yet to be publicly released by the company .

V, Exxon Mobil Corp. XOM, Omega Flex, Inc. OFLX and Weyco Group, Inc .  NVIDIA's shares have outperformed the Zacks Semiconductor - General industry over the past year (+6% vs. +4.1%) The company is benefiting from the strong growth of artificial intelligence (AI), high-performance and accelerated computing .  NVIDIA's revenues to witness a CAGR of 28.95% through fiscal 2026-2028 . Continued ramp-up of Ada RTX workstations in the ProViz end market, following the normalization of channel inventory, is acting as a tailwind . Collaborations with over 320 automakers and tier-one suppliers are likely to advance its presence in the autonomous vehicles space .  Visa shares outperformed the industry over the past year . The company faces rising client incentives and expenses, which may weigh slightly on margins . While declining cash volumes align with Visa's digital strategy, regional softness warrants monitoring .  Exxon Mobil reported better-than-expected Q1 earnings fueled by higher production from Guyana, the Permian and structural cost savings . Yet refining profits weakened due to a significant fall in industry refining margins . The refining margin pressure intensifies the reliance on upstream operations, which is vulnerable to fluctuating oil and gas prices .  Omega Flex dominates the U.S. flexible metal hose market via its TracPipe and CounterStrike lines . The company ended Q1 2025 with $49.2 million in cash and no debt, providing ample flexibility . Despite macro headwinds, it generated $1.6 million in operating cash flow and maintained dividend consistency .  Retail Apparel industry over the past year (+10.3% vs. -32.7%) Florsheim's 7% Q1 growth and traction in "refined casual" styles offset weakness in legacy brands like Nunn Bush and Stacy Adams . A special dividend and a 4% dividend hike show a commitment to shareholder returns .  Since 2000, our top stock-picking strategies have blown away the S&P's +7.7% average gain per year . Motley Fool analyst Matt Argersinger and host Ricky Mulvey discuss: What home sales data says about the economy . A traffic slowdown atChipotle, and the restaurant chain's strong unit economics . Warren Buffett could be sitting on a record amount of cash .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is995% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Don’t miss out on the latest top 10 list, available when you joinStock Advisor .  Home sales last month dropped to their slowest march pace since 2009 . Matt Argersinger: "Remember from a moment where we were in 2009. That's right. In the midst of a global financial crisis caused in part by a housing crash" Ricky Mulvey: "I'm definitely buying the CNBC version of this story."  Some sellers who have been waiting for mortgage rates to fall have decided that they can't keep waiting . This is one data point, but is this an inflecting point? What are you seeing here? Matt Argersinger:  Ricky Mulvey: We still have millions of homeowners locked into long term fixed mortgage rates under 5%, under 4%, in many cases, under 3% . Ricky: "I feel like, yes, we've got this rise in inventory data for March, but I don't think it's Dick's. sadly, the data could actually inflect downward Ricky .  D. R. Horton, the country's largest home builder, recently reported they're telling a very different story . Argersinger: There's a lot of questions for these Home Builders, specifically around tariffs . A lot of the people involved in new home construction are immigrants .  Home Builders have kept building throughout this whole period and have kept selling homes . But when I see the new home sales data, what I think it tells me is more about the demand side of the equation, which we know to be strong . We've got the biggest generation of first time home buyers in history .  Ricky Mulvey: New home sales are probably going to be heading in the wrong direction for the time being . Ricky: Mortgage rates are expensive, financing is hard to get. To get deals done, you have to do discounts which hurts your sales. At the same time, you mentioned you got higher labor costs, you've got higher input costs. You now have a lot of uncertainty about the economy and what these tariffs are going to do to your business. You're putting less shovels into the ground.  Matt Argersinger: Big story is the comp sales decline, comparable sales for Chipotle dropping about half a percent . This is the first drop since COVID and also coming off a heater, a five ish percent rise from last quarter . CEO Scott Boatwright, very quick to mention that this could be a weather problem and a macro problem .  Management said they expect things to improve by the second half . But you have to remember what they did last year . Look at COMMS Q2 of last year up 11.2%. That just shows you how tough the comparisons are going to get this year .  Ricky Mulvey: If you're a Chipotle shareholder, you have to anticipate that growth this year is going to be a lot slower than it was last year . A lot of the growth is really just going to come on the revenue side, Mulvey says . Mulvey hopes to start seeing management credit the weather when things are going well for them .  Matt Argersinger: Even with this decline in comparable sales, these are incredibly profitable businesses . Sales still growing six percent to about three billion dollars and they're still opening new restaurants, he says .  Ricky Mulvey: There's a Wall Street Journal column earlier this month that had the unfortunate title of your new lunch habit is hurting the economy . Mulvey says the number of lunches bought outside the home were lower in 2024 than in 2020, in the height of the pandemic . He says there's a version where Chipotle wins in this environment, where people are tightening their belts .  There's some headwinds here, but this is still really affordable compared to a lot of their competitors, Matt Argersinger says . Ricky Mulvey: If I go to Chipotle, I can get a steak bowl for about $11.50.  Berkshire Hathaway is sitting on more cash than any company ever in history . Ricky Mulvey: We're seeing a similar thing in Denver and what I've noticed is sometimes the mains are still all right .  Matt Argersinger: Is Warren Buffett battening down the hatches to buy up a bunch of stuff if the market turns south? Are you taking this cash pile as a macro signal? No. I think he's always invested with a long term mindset .  Buffett is the ultimate optimist when it comes to the future of the US economy . If Buffett saw a compelling investment or acquisition opportunity, he'd make it probably regardless of what Abel or anyone thinks . Ricky says this is actually macro sickling .  Buffett's favorite market valuation tool is the market cap GDP ratio . It's the total market capitalization of a country stock, US, relative to its gross domestic product . He said in the past, when that ratio is above 100%, the market is overvalued when it's below 100% .  The evidence is undeniable that Buffett thinks or thought that valuations were expensive, and he was preparing Berkshire Hathaway for just that . Matt Argersinger: I think he does see a lot of clouds on the horizon . Ricky Mulvey: There's probably storms ahead, not just for US stocks, but I think for the US economy .  US government changed its export rules for certain chips last week, particularly those that are going to China . This was a big news for Nvidia which warned of a $5.5 billion write-off as a result of that rule change . AMD was hit by those changes too. Mary Long and Asit Sharma continue their conversation about AMD and how macroeconomic forces are impacting the chipmaker .  AMD's MI308 chips are pared down versions of AMD's latest GPU series accelerators that go in data centers . They're purpose made for this market and 2025 was supposed to be the launch year for these chips . They have been in prototype and the R&D phase .  AMD and Nvidia are getting shut out of a market even on the lower end . The companies have been working around export controls for some time. They already understand they can't sell their most capable accelerators into China .  Asit Sharma: Are they designed but not yet built? Were they built, and there's already orders for them? Is there a stockpile of these designed manufactured chips that AMD thought it was going to be able to deliver to China that now is just going to sit there? Sharma: Total cost of all of this including some of the prototyping and investment is about 800 million .  Asit Sharma: AMD is taking some future opportunity off the books . Last year, AMD derived 25% of revenue from China, 6.23 billion . Sharma: There is a whole ecosystem of chips that are below the radar of US regulators that AMD is selling in China .  AMD announced that the company will be producing key processor units in the United States for the first time . Mary Long: The impact on my thesis isn't material. Near term though, there is, of course, that little bit of rerating on the stock .  TSMC has a new production facility in Arizona in the US and so more manufacturing will be able to take place stateside . Historically, TSMC's manufacturing has taken place in you guessed it, Taiwan . The timing of this announcement, it was pretty recent .  AMD has decided to start making chips in Taiwan rather than the U.S. because of the risk of disruption in the supply chain . AMD says the move is a 'big win' for TSMC as it has a specialised engineering workforce in Taiwan .  TSMC has branched out into South Korea, Japan, Germany and Arizona . AMD is looking to have smaller and smaller node processes out of that Arizona facility . Mary Long: In a tariffs world, it makes even more sense .  Asit Sharma: Thanks a lot for having me, Mary Longhas no longer happy to talk AMD. landscape. Ricky Mulvey: We'll be back tomorrow .  The Motley Fool recommends the following options: short June 2025 $55 calls on Chipotle Mexican Grill . Apple, D.R. Iyogin Holdings plans to resume buying Japanese government bondsonce 10-year yields rise to around 1.7%1.8%, CEO Kenji Miyoshi said . Less than 10% of the bank's 1.8 trillion portfolio is currently in JGBs, but that could rise to 50% if yields become attractive .

Nvidia (NVDA) has made a strong comeback and is just about 5% off from its record highs . Touted as the “Godfather of AI” by celebrated tech analyst Dan Ives, CEO Jensen Huang and his company are critical to not only the U.S.’s global prowess in chips, but are increasingly becoming key to diplomatic negotiations .  Nvidia is closing in on new record highs as it is just 5% shy of the record $153.13 set early in January . After 10 years its shares have soared more than 28,000%, driving the company to a valuation above $3.5 trillion . From hyperscalers to sovereign AI, Nvidia is becoming more and more irreplaceable .  Nvidia’s influence across the AI ecosystem remains unmatched, underpinned by both its relentless hardware innovation and a deeply intertwined software stack . The Blackwell architecture significantly enhances AI model training and inference, enabling more efficient and scalable AI applications .  Nvidia’s remarkable track record of outperforming market forecasts on both revenue and earnings remained intact in the most recent quarter . The chipmaker once again exceeded Wall Street expectations on the bottom line .  The company’s gross margin declined to 61%, down from 78.9% in the corresponding period last year . Still, Nvidia continues to command a dominant market share in the GPU segment, easing investor concerns about intensifying competition .  Analysts have attributed a rating of “Strong Buy” for NVDA stock with a mean target price of $174.02 . This indicates upside potential of about 20% from current levels . The impact of new restrictions on H20 shipments to China was lower than expected in Q1 .

Nvidia has witnessed explosive growth as generative AI hit the scene . Can the chipmaker maintain its momentum as the technology matures? Long-term investing is the key to sustainable returns in the stock market .  Revenue jumped 69% year over year to $44.1 billion, but this is a sharp deceleration from the corresponding period last year when sales grew by 262% . Trump administration severely restricted export of company's H20 chips to China, leading to a $4.5 billion impairment charge .  Nvidia's powerful chip remains crucial in the nascent stages of the AI industry, but it is unclear how much longer its economic moat will last . The company is pioneering a concept it calls sovereign AI, which suggests that different parts of the world need to build their own language models to serve their unique historical, cultural, and political realities .  Nvidia seems to be transitioning away from being an explosive growth stock into a mature value stock . Over the long term, national governments could become a stable and reliable source for the business' chip design . Broadcom stock has delivered stronger returns than Nvidia in the past year . Despite its larger revenue base, Nvidia continues to grow faster than Broadcom . A look at valuations helps clarify which AI stock is the better one right now .  Broadcom's custom AI processors are in great demand right now as they are being deployed in huge numbers by cloud hyperscalers for AI inferencing . The company has three customers that are expected to deploy more than 1 million units each of its custom AI processor in their cloud clusters in 2027 . This would be a big jump over the 30,000 units deployed in each cloud cluster last year .  The number of customers using Broadcom's AI chips is likely to go up to seven from the current three . The chipmaker reportedly designs chips for Alphabet, Meta, and ByteDance at present, and there are indications that it could add the likes of Oracle, xAI, andSoftBank to its list as well . This potential expansion of the company's AI customer base could help it sustain its 70% share of the custom AI processor market .  Nvidia's data center revenue increased 73% year over year thanks to the demand for its AI chips . Broadcom's AI revenue growth, on the other hand, was relatively slower at 46% . Nvidia has focused on improving the inference performance of its GPUs, which is helping its customers reduce operating costs .  McKinsey is forecasting an investment of $5.2 trillion worldwide in AI data centers by 2030 . That would leave abundant room for growth in the company's data center business . Nvidia's gaming and AI personal computer (PC) business grew 42% year over year in the previous quarter . The adoption of AI is projected to increase at a nice clip in both these markets, promising outstanding growth .  Nvidia's growth is better than Broadcom's even though the former is a much bigger company . Even though Broadcom stock may have outperformed Nvidia in the past year, the valuation and growth profile of the two companies suggests the latter is a better AI stock to buy . SoftBank founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to team up with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. to realize what could be his biggest bet yet . Son envisions a version of Shenzhen that would bring back high-tech manufacturing to the US . The park may comprise production lines for AI-powered industrial robots, people say .  Project Crystal Land is SoftBank's most ambitious attempt in a career that’s spanned numerous bet-the-house bids, thousands-fold-returns and billions of dollars in losses . It's not clear what part Son sees for TSMC, which already plans to invest $165 billion in the US .  The project has been floated to executives at South Korea’s Samsung Electronics Co. of Commerce Howard Lutnick . Son has pulled together a list of SoftBank Vision Fund portfolio companies that might take part in the project .  SoftBank-backed startups working on robotics and automation technologies may set up production facilities at the industrial complex . SoftBank is exploring the Arizona project as it also moves forward on plans to invest as much as $30 billion into OpenAI and plans to buy Ampere Computing LLC .  SoftBank’s cash stood at ¥3.4 trillion ($23 billion) at the end of March . The Tokyo-based company has since tapped its T-Mobile US Inc. stake, selling roughly a quarter of what it held in March to raise $4.8 billion this month . SoftBank also has net assets valued at ¥25.7 trillion, of which chip designer Arm Holdings Plc makes the single largest portion .  Masayoshi Son’s ambition to set up a trillion-dollar industrial complex in Arizona could signal additional, aggressive investments . SoftBank might need to monetize mature assets, as it did in a recent $4.8 billion sale of a stake in T-Mobile .  Musk is a "long-term thinker, and he takes risks," analyst says . But pouring cash into data centers may help lower the cost of developing AI applications and spur broader adoption, she says .

Foxconn and U.S.artificial intelligencechips maker Nvidia are in talks to deploy humanoid robots at a new Foxconn factory in Houston that will produce Nvidia AI servers . A deployment, expected to be finalised in the coming months, would mark a milestone in the adoption of the human-like robots that promises to transform manufacturing processes .  Foxconn's new Houston factory will begin production of Nvidia's GB300 AI servers in the first quarter of next year . Foxconn has been training robots to pick and place objects, insert cables and do assembly work .  Nvidia announced in April it planned to build AI supercomputer manufacturing factories in Texas, partnering with Foxconn in Houston and Wistron in Dallas . One of those will be with legs and the other will use a wheeled autonomous mobile robot (AMR) base .  The robots can be used to perform tasks such as those performed by robots . The robots are often used to pick up the tasks performed by such robots .

There seems at least a solid probability that Nvidia stock still has not just good or great but amazing growth potential left . Year-over-year earnings growth solidly in the double-digit percentages and a reasonable stock valuation should be all that's needed to keep Nvidia investors very happy . Think of it as "Nvidia the superstar stock 2.0"  Nvidia has a market cap of $3.55 trillion, as of June 18, making it the world's second most valuable publicly traded company . Nvidia management expects the company to generate revenue of $45 billion in its fiscal second quarter, which equates to an annual revenue run rate of $180 billion .  Nvidia stock is trading at 25.4 times Wall Street's projected forward earnings per share, or EPS, as of June 18 . That's an attractive valuation for a company that analysts expect to grow EPS at an average annual rate of 30% over the next five years . The main reason I think the valuation will likely remain relatively reasonable (at least much of the time) for a while .  Nvidia stock's valuation is reasonable in part because Wall Street analysts are going to tend to be too conservative in their estimates, in my view . Some investors will probably feel that Wall Street is being too liberal in its estimates because they themselves feel cautious given Nvidia's humongous size .  Nvidia's GPUs will be the "brains" inside many of the autonomous vehicles . The company will stay ahead of the innovation pack by entering emerging new technologies via organic growth and acquisitions . An example here is quantum computing, in which Nvidia will be increasingly involved . AMD launched its MI350X and MI355X AI accelerators, which compete with Nvidia's Blackwell products . The MI400 series is coming next year and expected to deliver a tenfold increase in performance . MI400 and AMD's Helios rack-scale solution can help the company grow its AI chip business .  AMD's MI350X and MI355X are capable AI accelerators, but they fail to leapfrog Nvidia's Blackwell-based products . The MI400 series will feature 288 GB of HBM3E memory and 8 terabytes per second (TB/s) of memory bandwidth . The company claims the flagship MI400X will be 10 times more powerful than the MI300X, an enormous leap in just a few years .  AMD's MI400X should beat Nvidia's current generation of products handily in terms of performance . Nvidia's next-gen Rubin chip is expected to more than triple compute performance over its predecessor . AMD is planning to launch a new rack-scale AI solution called Helios in 2026 .  AMD sees the market for AI chips reaching $500 billion by 2028 . With annual AI accelerator revenue at just $5 billion for 2024, AMD doesn't need to beat Nvidia to grow its AI chip business .  With the MI400 series and Helios slated for 2026, AMD is positioned to grow its AI-related revenue substantially over the next few years . AMD is almost certain to remain in a distant second place behind Nvidia .  Is995% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172%for the S&P 500 . Nvidia management is excited about the company's long-term growth potential . Data center-related capital expenditures could reach $1 trillion annually by 2028 . The signs point to Nvidia, based on its impressive growth and the increasing market for its products .  AI hyperscalers are racing to install as much equipment as possible to run AI workloads . Nvidia is the main supplier of the graphics processing units (GPUs) central to their operation . While there are alternatives to Nvidia's products, it has a 90% or greater share in the data center GPU market .  Global data center spending is expected to rise to $1 trillion by 2028, Nvidia says . For every $100 spent on data centers, about $29 went to Nvidia . Nvidia will still make about $160 billion in revenue from data centers alone in 2028 .  If Nvidia's market cap were increased by the corresponding revenue growth, it would be $5.03 trillion . Nvidia's potential is still rising, and investors should ensure that they're invested in thistop-notch AI play . CoreWeave has emerged as a new AI stock to watch . The tech company is new to the market, having launched its initial public offering in March . Despite robust share price returns, Nvidia is quietly building a quantum computing business that investors might not want to overlook . IonQ, Rigetti Computing, and D-Wave Quantum are among some of the more popular quantum computing stocks right now .  Nvidia reports its revenue into five major buckets: data center, gaming, professional visualization, automotive, and other . Today, nearly 90% of the company's revenue stems from the data center segment . Cloud hyperscalers such asMicrosoft,Alphabet, andAmazon, as well as other major AI developers, includingMeta PlatformsandOracle, have been on a relentless buying spree for Nvidia's chips .  Nvidia is already parlaying the CUDA application to quantum computing, aptly naming the program CUDA-Q . Nvidia maintains a sizable lead over its competition in the chip landscape . I see the rise of quantum computing as an opportunity for Nvidia to diversify its business .  As I write this (June 16), Nvidia is trading at a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 33.7 . This isn't exactly dirt cheap . I think continuing to offer additional software applications through CUDA should help Nvidia maintain a healthy profit margin .  Nvidia remains a much cheaper stock today than it was a year ago based on forward P/E trends . While there is some momentum fueling the share price right now, I would still encourage investors to consider scooping up shares .
